concept.title: and Chef
concept.shortdesc: Chef software is an open source configuration management tool that you can use to create parts of an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS). You can use Chef to provision an installation.

conbody.p: Chef recipes and cookbooks allow reusable definitions and code reuse to automate common infrastructure tasks. Using Chef enables you to create a scalable infrastructure with minimal configuration to maintain. You can then easily expand your existing infrastructure by creating, starting, and deploying a new server as required.
To learn more about Chef concepts, see the online Chef documentation, About Cookbooks - Chef Docs.

The beta Chef cookbook provides a Chef HWRP (Heavyweight Resource Provider) library that you can include in Chef recipes to help you to tailor to your own configuration requirements. In addition, a demo cookbook is provided to showcase an example use case of the beta Chef cookbook. The beta Chef cookbook is available on BetaWorks.
